info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:39PM EDT until June 17 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... At 839 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jamestown to near Moncks Corner, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Goose Creek, Moncks Corner, Ladson, Bonneau, Jamestown, Crowfield Plantation, Old Santee Canal State Park and Pinopolis. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
